Class ExplicitLayout

java.lang.Object
  |

java.awt.LayoutManager, java.awt.LayoutManager2, java.io.Serializable
public class ExplicitLayout
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.LayoutManager2, java.io.Serializable

A layout manager that provides explicit control over the layout of components.

See Also:

getNamedConstraints

public java.util.Enumeration getNamedConstraints()
Gets an enumeration of all the named constraints. These are constraints constructed using ExplicitConstraints(Component component, String name) for which ExplicitConstraints.getName is not null.

Throws:

addLayoutComponent(Component , Object)

addLayoutComponent

public void addLayoutComponent(java.awt.Component component,
                               java.lang.Object constraints)
Adds the specified component to the layout using the specified constraints. The constraints must be an instance of ExplicitConstraints. If constraints is null, the component's size and location will not be changed by ExplicitLayout. This can be used when migrating to ExplicitLayout from a prototype null layout; direct calls to component.setBounds will still be effective if constrains is null.

Specified by:
addLayoutComponent in interface java.awt.LayoutManager2
Parameters:
component - the component to add to the layout
constraints - the constraints of the component
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if constraints is not an instance of ExplicitConstraints
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the component specified by the constraints is null or different from the component being added.
See Also:
ExplicitConstraints

setMaximumLayoutSize

public void setMaximumLayoutSize(Expression width,
                                 Expression height)
Sets expressions for the maximum width and height of the container. The expressions should not include the container's internal borders as returned by the Container getInsets method.

Parameters:
width - an expression for the maximum width of the container.
height - an expression for the maximum height of the container.

maximumLayoutSize

public java.awt.Dimension maximumLayoutSize(java.awt.Container parent)
Gets the maximum layout size for the container calculated by adding the container's insets to the maximum size expressions specified by the setMaximumLayoutSize method. If the setMaximumLayoutSize method has not been called, return dimension Integer.MAX_VALUE, Integer.MAX_VALUE.

Specified by:
maximumLayoutSize in interface java.awt.LayoutManager2
Parameters:
parent - the container to which this layout manager belongs.

setPreferredLayoutSize

public void setPreferredLayoutSize(Expression width,
                                   Expression height)
Sets expressions for the preferred width and height of the container. The expressions should not include insets.

Parameters:
width - an expression for the preferred width of the container.
height - an expression for the preferred height of the container.

preferredLayoutSize

public java.awt.Dimension preferredLayoutSize(java.awt.Container parent)
Gets the preferred layout size for the container calculated by adding the container's insets to the preferred size expressions specified by the setPreferredLayoutSize method. If the setPreferredLayoutSize method has not been called, return dimension 100,100.

Specified by:
preferredLayoutSize in interface java.awt.LayoutManager
Parameters:
parent - the container to which this layout manager belongs.

public java.awt.Dimension minimumLayoutSize(java.awt.Container parent)
Gets the minimum layout size for the container calculated by adding the container's insets to the minimum size expressions specified by the setMinimumLayoutSize method. If the setMinimumLayoutSize method has not been called, return dimension 0,0.

layoutContainer

public void layoutContainer(java.awt.Container parent)
This method sets the size and position of each component as defined in the component's ExplicitConstraints object.

Specified by:
layoutContainer in interface java.awt.LayoutManager
Parameters:
parent - the container to which this layout manager belongs.

setLayoutListener

public void setLayoutListener(LayoutListener layoutListener)
Sets a LayoutListener.

The LayoutListener.beforeLayout method is called by layoutContainer before the container is layed out. This gives the the LayoutListener opprotunity to modify the constraints before the container is layed out.

For example, a LayoutListener could be used to set different layout constraints depending on the container's width / height ratio.

Parameters:
layoutListener - a object that implements LayoutListener; null to remove the layout listener.

getLayoutListener

public LayoutListener getLayoutListener()
Gets the current layout listener.

Returns:
the layout listener or null.
